column4: I have a hopelessly locked system here, looked up REISUB, and tried it - no luck. Suggestions?
please explain, what happened, how it happened and what you've attempted
my wireless connection dropped, wasn't using the system, it just decided to quit. This is the first time. U9.10, latest kernel.
I tried Alt+PrintScr REISUB, but nothing happened.
upper case reisub, by the way.
might sound silly have you tried restarting, checking router wireless key, checking your router actually connects to the internet and I have no clue what reisub is
thanks.
readin logs aint fun and not easy your going to read it line per line
no sweat for me, do you know what log? I found something interesting, in messages - it shows eth0 entering promiscuous mode. I'm not using eth0.
google it thats the best advise I can give you when you find messages like that
Tell you what, when and if I find what I'm looking for I'll let you know. ;)
ok
system>Pref..>power management
As I said, that is disabled.
you sure, on mine it is set to never put the system to sleep unless its a bios issue
I'm sure. The system is a power edge server, I went through the bios prior to install. I think I will disable ACPI, been wanting too anyway.
Update, pm-utils and acpid were still active - even though they were "disabled" They no longer exist on my system :)
i ahve no clue what youre trying to achieve but hope you dont break your system
It's a desktop, and I don't want / need power management. It crashed my system, so it goes away. That's it, that's all.
oh ok fair enough
yeah, it's been dropping the wireless connection (what I thought was) randomly, but this time I decided to look into it rather than live with it. Power management.
if it works for you without a problem than problem solved
he is just getting his server up for the first time.
Oh :s I wasn't aware...
